methods.javadoc: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the line.
methods.name: cursorHome
methods.comment: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the line.

methods.javadoc: Moves the cursor to the end of the line.
methods.name: cursorEnd
methods.comment: Moves the cursor to the end of the line.

methods.javadoc: Returns the default background color.
methods.name: getBackgroundColor
methods.comment: Returns the default background color.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the default background color
@param c the color to use for the background.
methods.name: setBackgroundColor
methods.comment: Sets the default background color

params.name: c
params.comment: the color to use for the background.

methods.javadoc: Returns the foreground color.
methods.name: getForegroundColor
methods.comment: Returns the foreground color.

methods.javadoc: Returns the color used as the background for selected items.
methods.name: getSelectionColor
methods.comment: Returns the color used as the background for selected items.

methods.javadoc: Returns the color color used as the background for highlighted items.
methods.name: getHighlightColor
methods.comment: Returns the color color used as the background for highlighted items.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current cursor color.
methods.name: getFocusedCursorColor
methods.comment: Returns the current cursor color.

methods.javadoc: Cleans up resources when this FieldPanel is no longer needed.
methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Cleans up resources when this FieldPanel is no longer needed.

methods.javadoc: Returns the point in pixels of where the cursor is located.
methods.name: getCursorPoint
methods.comment: Returns the point in pixels of where the cursor is located.

methods.javadoc:
Add a new hover service to be managed.
@param hoverService the new hover service to be managed.
methods.name: setHoverProvider
methods.comment: Add a new hover service to be managed.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the class responsible for triggering popups for this field panel.
@return the hover handler.
methods.name: getHoverHandler
methods.comment: Returns the class responsible for triggering popups for this field panel.

methods.name: getFieldAt
methods.comment:
Returns the Field at the given x,y coordinates. Note the x,y must
 currently be visible on the screen or else this method will return null.

params.name: x
params.comment: the x mouse coordinate in the component.

params.name: y
params.comment: the y mouse coordinate in the component.

params.name: loc
params.comment:
will be filled in with the FieldLocation for the given point.
            Values will be undefined if the Field return value is null.

return.comment: Field the Field object the point is over.

methods.javadoc: Clears the selection;
methods.name: clearSelection
methods.comment: Clears the selection;

methods.javadoc: Clears the marked area highlight;
methods.name: clearHighlight
methods.comment: Clears the marked area highlight;

methods.name: setFocusedCursorColor
methods.comment: Sets the cursor color for when this component has focus.

params.name: color
params.comment:
Color to use for the cursor when this component has keyboard
            focus.

methods.name: setNonFocusCursorColor
methods.comment: Sets the cursor color for when this component does not have focus.

params.name: color
params.comment:
Color to use for the cursor when this component does not have
            keyboard focus.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current selection.
methods.name: getSelection
methods.comment: Returns the current selection.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current highlight (marked area).
methods.name: getHighlight
methods.comment: Returns the current highlight (marked area).

methods.javadoc:
Sets the current selection.
@param sel the selection to set.
methods.name: setSelection
methods.comment: Sets the current selection.

params.name: sel
params.comment: the selection to set.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the current highlight to the specified field selection.
@param sel the selection to set as the highlight.
methods.name: setHighlight
methods.comment: Sets the current highlight to the specified field selection.

params.name: sel
params.comment: the selection to set as the highlight.

methods.name: setCursorPosition
methods.comment: Sets the cursorPosition to the given location.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the Layout on which to place the cursor.

params.name: fieldNum
params.comment:
the index of the field within its layout on which to place the
        cursor.

params.name: row
params.comment: the row within the field to place the cursor.

params.name: col
params.comment: the col within the row to place the cursor.

methods.name: setCursorOn
methods.comment:
Sets the cursor on or off. When the cursor is turned off, there is no
 visible cursor displayed on the screen.

params.name: cursorOn
params.comment: true turns the cursor on, false turns it off.

methods.javadoc: Returns the state of the cursor. True if on, false if off.
methods.name: isCursorOn
methods.comment: Returns the state of the cursor. True if on, false if off.

methods.name: goTo
methods.comment:
Sets the cursor to the given Field location and attempts to show that
 location in the center of the screen.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the line to go to.

params.name: fieldNum
params.comment: the field on the line to go to.

params.name: row
params.comment: the row in the field to go to.

params.name: col
params.comment: the column in the field to go to.

methods.javadoc: Tell the panel to grab the keyboard input focus.
methods.name: takeFocus
methods.comment: Tell the panel to grab the keyboard input focus.

methods.javadoc:
Scrolls the view so that the cursor is at the given offset from the top
 of the screen
@param offset the pixel distance from the top of the screen at which to
            scroll the display such that the cursor is at that offset.
methods.name: positionCursor
methods.comment:
Scrolls the view so that the cursor is at the given offset from the top
 of the screen

params.name: offset
params.comment:
the pixel distance from the top of the screen at which to
            scroll the display such that the cursor is at that offset.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the selection color
@param color the color to use for selection.
methods.name: setSelectionColor
methods.comment: Sets the selection color

params.name: color
params.comment: the color to use for selection.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the highlight color
@param color the color to use for highlights.
methods.name: setHighlightColor
methods.comment: Sets the highlight color

params.name: color
params.comment: the color to use for highlights.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a ViewerPosition object which contains the top of screen
 information. The ViewerPosition will have the index of the layout at the
 top of the screen and the yPos of that layout. For example, if the layout
 is completely displayed, yPos will be 0. If part of the layout is off the
 top off the screen, then yPos will have a negative value (indicating that
 it begins above the displayable part of the screen.
methods.name: getViewerPosition
methods.comment:
Returns a ViewerPosition object which contains the top of screen
 information. The ViewerPosition will have the index of the layout at the
 top of the screen and the yPos of that layout. For example, if the layout
 is completely displayed, yPos will be 0. If part of the layout is off the
 top off the screen, then yPos will have a negative value (indicating that
 it begins above the displayable part of the screen.

methods.name: setViewerPosition
methods.comment:
Scrolls the display to show the layout specified by index at the vertical
 position specified by yPos. Generally, the index will be layout at the
 top of the screen and the yPos will be = 0, meaning the layout may be
 partially off the top of the screen.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the layout to show at the top of the screen.

params.name: yPos
params.comment: the position to show the layout.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the layout model for this field panel
@param model the layout model to use.
methods.name: setLayoutModel
methods.comment: Sets the layout model for this field panel

params.name: model
params.comment: the layout model to use.

methods.javadoc: Returns the offset of the cursor from the top of the screen
methods.name: getCursorOffset
methods.comment: Returns the offset of the cursor from the top of the screen
